segment.source: DISM Configuration List and WimScript.ini Files
segment.target: DISM Configuration List and WimScript.ini Files

segment.source: DISM Configuration List and WimScript.ini Files
segment.target: DISM Configuration List and WimScript.ini Files

segment.source: DISM Configuration List and WimScript.ini Files
segment.target: DISM Configuration List and WimScript.ini Files

segment.source: The Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool is a command-line tool that you can use to capture and apply Windows images.
segment.target: The Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool is a command-line tool that you can use to capture and apply Windows images.

segment.source: You can create a configuration list file to determine the following:
segment.target: You can create a configuration list file to determine the following:

segment.source: Which files and folders must be excluded from the capture process when you use the /Capture-Image option with the DISM tool.
segment.target: Which files and folders must be excluded from the capture process when you use the /Capture-Image option with the DISM tool.

segment.source: Which folders, files, and file types must be excluded from the compression process when you use the /Compress argument.
segment.target: Which folders, files, and file types must be excluded from the compression process when you use the /Compress argument.

segment.source: If you name your configuration list file wimscript.ini and store it in your DISM directory (where the DISM.exe file is located), it will automatically run when you use the /Capture-Image option (with or without the /Compress argument) without requiring you to use the /ConfigFile argument.
segment.target: If you name your configuration list file wimscript.ini and store it in your DISM directory (where the DISM.exe file is located), it will automatically run when you use the /Capture-Image option (with or without the /Compress argument) without requiring you to use the /ConfigFile argument.

segment.source: The /ConfigFile argument enables you to customize specific compression, capture, and boundary alignment actions for each file and folder when you capture an image using DISM.exe.
segment.target: The /ConfigFile argument enables you to customize specific compression, capture, and boundary alignment actions for each file and folder when you capture an image using DISM.exe.

segment.source: You can create a configuration list (.ini) file by using a text editor, such as Notepad.
segment.target: You can create a configuration list (.ini) file by using a text editor, such as Notepad.

segment.source: Creating a Configuration List File
segment.target: Creating a Configuration List File

segment.source: The following sections appear in the DISM configuration list file.
segment.target: The following sections appear in the DISM configuration list file.

segment.source: Section
segment.target: Section

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Enables you to define the files and folders to exclude when you use the /Capture-Image option.
segment.target: Enables you to define the files and folders to exclude when you use the /Capture-Image option.

segment.source: Enables you to override the default exclusion list when you use the /Capture-Image option.
segment.target: Enables you to override the default exclusion list when you use the /Capture-Image option.

segment.source: Enables you to define the specific files and folders, and also to specify file types, to exclude when you use the /Compress argument.
segment.target: Enables you to define the specific files and folders, and also to specify file types, to exclude when you use the /Compress argument.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can use file or folder matching to exclude a file from compression.
segment.target: You can use file or folder matching to exclude a file from compression.

segment.source: You can provide a full path match, or you can use wildcard characters (*).
segment.target: You can provide a full path match, or you can use wildcard characters (*).

segment.source: For example, you can use \WINDOWS\inf.pnf to match a specific type of file, or \WINDOWS\inf to match a whole folder.
segment.target: For example, you can use \WINDOWS\inf.pnf to match a specific type of file, or \WINDOWS\inf to match a whole folder.

segment.source: Default Exclusion List
segment.target: Default Exclusion List

segment.source: By default, the DISM.exe tool will exclude the following files.
segment.target: By default, the DISM.exe tool will exclude the following files.

segment.source: Exclusion List Guidelines
segment.target: Exclusion List Guidelines

segment.source: You can only use wildcard characters in the last component in a file path that does not begin with a backslash.
segment.target: You can only use wildcard characters in the last component in a file path that does not begin with a backslash.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: You can use a preceding backslash to limit file-matching and directory-matching relative to the root directory.
segment.target: You can use a preceding backslash to limit file-matching and directory-matching relative to the root directory.

segment.source: For example, you can use this exclusion list:
segment.target: For example, you can use this exclusion list:

segment.source: This list will exclude the following files and directories when you capture the "C:" drive:
segment.target: This list will exclude the following files and directories when you capture the "C:" drive:

segment.source: However, DISM will not exclude files or directories that are contained in the following example.
segment.target: However, DISM will not exclude files or directories that are contained in the following example.

segment.source: You can override the default exclusion list by using the section.
segment.target: You can override the default exclusion list by using the section.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: If an explicit section is provided in the WIM configuration file, it will always take precedence over the section.
segment.target: If an explicit section is provided in the WIM configuration file, it will always take precedence over the section.

segment.source: You cannot override the default compression exclusion list by using the section.
segment.target: You cannot override the default compression exclusion list by using the section.

segment.source: Using the Configuration File
segment.target: Using the Configuration File

segment.source: If you create a custom-named configuration file and store it outside the DISM directory, you can use the DISM command to run the file.
segment.target: If you create a custom-named configuration file and store it outside the DISM directory, you can use the DISM command to run the file.

segment.source: At a command prompt, open the DISM directory.
segment.target: At a command prompt, open the DISM directory.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: or
segment.target: or

segment.source: where configuration list provides the complete directory location for the configuration file.
segment.target: where configuration list provides the complete directory location for the configuration file.

segment.source: For example, .
segment.target: For example, .

segment.source: You must use either the /Capture-Image option to create a new .wim file or the /Append-Image option to append an existing .wim file.
segment.target: You must use either the /Capture-Image option to create a new .wim file or the /Append-Image option to append an existing .wim file.
